title: Student Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Checked in at the front desk and met the supervisor who was responsible for the Learning Assistant program at UC Learning Commons. The supervisor was nice. They asked some questions and describe your roles. You can ask them questions if you have.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this job? How can this job help you in your future career? How many hours are you available per week? How can you deal with students? What would you do if students come to your office hours with no questions?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fair and simple, with interviewee looking more for attitude and willingness to jump in and help than actual skills and experience, which opens up opportunity for all students.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to get from this position?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Easy and straightforward, managers were very nice and knew by the end of day whether or you you had the job. Very easy entry level job though. Great entry to the trauma healthcare community.
Interview Questions: Used the STAR method so just be careful

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Initially, it consisted of an interview with the Department Head, usually before the start of a semester. As I moved up in the world the decisions seemed to involve department committee.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my teaching experience; this was a long time ago though..

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 separate interviews all via Microsoft teams. They were really straight forward. I had my first interview and got an email the next day to set up another interview. After the second interview I got an email the same day to set up my third.
Interview Questions: They asked “tell me about yourself” “what experience do you have that would make you a great fit for this role” etc.

title: PACE Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Easy just one interview to get the position that you want. It’s a pretty standard interview and not very difficult overall to prep for as a college student. Very Easy first job for college students
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was a remote interview for an office job. I got a phone screen and then was rushed to the second round, which was about a two-three hour process with multiple segments/departments/groups. They also wanted a "pitch" of 10-15 minutes for a job paying >50k a year. This is a position that I was definitely qualified for and I'd say I even received what seemed to be "soft" indicators from the hiring manager that I'd receive an offer for. Then I got radio silence for two weeks and had to email the hiring manager twice to even learn that I hadn't been selected for an offer. This is poor behavior in my view and I won't be applying to UC in the near future bc I've had one other similar experience in recent history. The pay is always on the low end and the hiring process involves too many requests for free work/unpaid steps. It seems like they don't care b/c they're getting paid so they think you're just honored to interview with them(?)  Times have changed.  UC, please only ask for these things if you're extremely serious about the candidate.
Interview Questions: Just general cookie-cutter material. You can guess.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was not as hard as I thought. The interviewer was friendly and enthusiastic, which made me feel less worried and more confident in myself. Overall, it is a great experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply for this job?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: The interview for PhD aspirants varies from lab to lab. My interview focused on the hands on experience I had and how motivated I was to pursue research and PhD.
Interview Questions:
How motivated are you to do research?

What experimental techniques  do you have experience with?

title: Contractor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Horrible communication with regard to sun contract work under direct supervision of dept chair for a remodel. I have no further to discuss. It’s an issue that needs to be addressed.
Interview Questions: I don’t truly remember the interview

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: You will get asked around your past experience and situation based question. They want to know your personality if you fit this position or not. They want to know your future goal and in what way this job will benefit you.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when worked in team and what was your contribution in it? what did you learn from this?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer is friendly. Don't need to print your resume. It takes 20-30 mins. Need to prepare the answers for questions about job requirements, what you know about the Learning Commons, your availability, and how you can deal with the work with your schedule.
Interview Questions:
- What do you know about this position?
- Total hours you can do the job each week?
- Why do you want that job?
- Your strength? Your weakness?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief and consisted of the hiring manager spending most of the conversation discussing the position. He did not allow a lot of time for questions and only asked me one question during the interview. It did not feel like an interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grants Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted by an HR partner for the College of Medicine. Received an email a few months later asking if I was still interested in moving forward. Had a virtual interview with a team and heard back about 3 business days later with another interview offer. The interviews were one hour each.
Interview Questions: Why I want to leave my current job.

title: ESL Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: just sit down and discuss our school, review your resume and related experience, and then ask/answer questions. The person has asked me questions related to my work experience, teaching methods, and theoretical leanings.
Interview Questions: How was your tutoring and teaching experience?  what did you do?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: It gives us some basic interview questions, mainly focused on the research background. To be honest, it is not hard, and feel comfortable during the interview. The salary is not bad and I am still considering this offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about your research background

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Lead me on for over a month. Did 3 rounds of interview, never heard back. When I reached out they said they wanted to do my references and never heard back again. Reached back out again and that is when I found out they went with another candidate. Waste of time.
Interview Questions: How to manage your workload?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Typical software development questions. There does not seem to be any work/life balance at all. Low pto, below average salary.  
A bit surprised, and disappointed at the low give, considering the high take. I
Interview Questions: SDLC life cycle...usual development questions.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: the interview for the resident advisor position at the University of Cincinnati, Ohio for the college year 2022 - 2023 was a bit challenging and tough. However the staff members were extremely kind.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: The process felt very scripted as if there was a lot of institutional control over the whole process.  I don't feel as if they were able to get to know the real me with this rigid process.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching style?

title: Computer and Information Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed with three members of the IT department. They emphasized large networking issues, such as bandwidth issues, and interdepartmental communication and concerns. Questions focused on demonstrating knowledge of DHCP servers, DNS, LAN/WAN, and AD setup, and SCCM in particular.
Interview Questions:
Define DNS
What does LAN stand for?
What does WAN stand for?
Demonstrate troubleshooting experience

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The PI let me give a talk in front of the group and meet individually with the PI after the talk. I did not get what I wanted, but instead the PI offered me another position.
Interview Questions: Let me give a talk.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in person on campus. I was asked about previous education and also teaching experience. Questions were pretty typical for a college teaching assistant position. Very friendly faculty. Reccomend working here.
Interview Questions: Describe your teaching background and history.

title: IRB Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Campus, OH) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Three interviewers, asked many questions. They asked the same questions to all candidates. The interview process lasted for over 1 hours. I think the interaction is very good because they also talked a lot about their opinions about the city and the university.
Interview Questions:
Introduce self
What you expect for a good leader

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had to scheduled 3Interviews within 1-2 weeks. Somewhat of a challenge for an out of state candidate. This seems to be the usual process with all positions at this company.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was quick after I applied.  It only took about a week to schedule an interview. They were very professional and polite during the process. However was difficult to get a hold of after interview. The interviewer and I went back and forth with voice messages for about a week before I never heard again.
Interview Questions: What is your experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: I have a brief interview with an adviser working in the field of synthesis carbon-based materials in person.  The interview was 20-30 minutes asking about some behavior and technical questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join our group?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview with manager, other employee. Non professional. Talked about other applicants to me, discussing their resumes. No real questions about my future plans or what I’d like to accomplish through new position.
Interview Questions: Current work load and job plans for future

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: 4-5 hour interview, meet with students, staff, supervisor and director. All asked similar questions. Lunch was provided. Received a response within two weeks. Overall, typical and good process. Not too difficult.
Interview Questions: Describe your leadership style?

title: Marketing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: It was a co-op position and I had the interview due to a co-op advisor recommendation. I was given a contact and then an e-mail address and phone number and told they would be expecting my call within 48 hours.
Interview Questions: If I enjoyed sports to the core of my being.

title: Assistant Managing Editor-Libraries Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: A time for a video interview was set up via phone call. Two emails with the names of the members on the hiring committee and instructions for setting up the requisite app followed. All three members of the committee took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you have had to go above and beyond to complete a project.

title: Institutional Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: First interview was over the phone. Basically an introduction and explained to them that I was in a master's program. Second interview was in person. Met everyone from the office, and was asked more in depth questions about my experiences and was also given a test.
Interview Questions: What computer programs do you have experience with?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
A few weeks after I applied online, I was contacted by HR to set up a phone interview.  It was a panel interview that was quite formal;  not conversational at all, just question then answer, question then answer.  The questions seemed harder than the job description made the job out to be. 

About a week and a half after my phone interview, I was invited to campus for an interview face-to-face.  The interview was with the same panel I originally interviewed with, plus several more people with whom the position would work directly.  The questions were all very relevant to the job.   A week after the interview I was offered the position.  It will be almost two and a half months by the time I start the job from the time I applied.
Interview Questions: How does the position align with your career goals?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: 5 interviewers. Very intimidating and grueling. They did a pre-phone interview, similar style.  The questions did not have anything to do with the position and I felt very uncomfortable the entire time.
Interview Questions: Tell us about an experience that you didn't get the outcome you wanted and how you handled it.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were two in person interviews and a chance to shadow unit for a couple of hours. I was given a chance to ask questions. Staff were very friendly and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UCMC?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interview went well the interviewer ask me about myself and career path.
Describe the activities of the program and character questions. 
It took very long for them to get back with me.
Interview Questions: So tell me about yourself.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, IL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview questions such as Tell me something that is not in your resume. One problem that you solved. One time you disagreed with your manager and such similar questions
Interview Questions: Behavioral. Why do you want this job?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: two interviews in 2 days. Technical and Behavior questions. a group of experts that asked these questions. The overall process is good. But, the some questions should be prepared as a paper format.
Interview Questions: Some technical problems about future jobs

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a former employee to the professor who was in charge of hiring. I was emailed about an interview after a week or so. It was a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach physics?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: no interview when they hired me.  I just file the application forms and send it to them after few months they accept my application . I hope it is enough information          .
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit a resume and a cover letter. I had one interview with a few staff members from the department. It took 2 weeks before they reached out to me with an offer.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?
What would you do if you made a mistake?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick hiring process that engaged in a phone interview and in-person interview. Offer was given in 3 weeks. Were very understanding of timelines of start date. Quick to respond to questions.
Interview Questions: How I develop students?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Informal process, general questions.  Allowed more of a discussion than a general question/answer format.  The interview was easy and no challenging questions.   The basic questions, why do you want to work here, what are your strengths, weaknesses
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I went through 3 interviews, the first was over the phone, then skype and in person for the last. The department really made me feel comfortable and relaxed. I did not feel nervous or silly, as we often do during interviews
Interview Questions: Why did you chose the University of Cincinnati?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
easy and friendly for the most part. met with multiple people 1:1. good coordination and arrangements. hospitality was good. after first visit, was invited for a second visit too, and had a phone conversation at some point too. 
as usual, first interview is more about me, and second interview is what I need to know about them ( they already like me, so now I can feel free to ask more detailed questions)
Interview Questions: why I have chosen Univ of Cincinnati

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, the questions were related to previous experiences as GA, previous research and articles, how can you help the professor in his research. How are you different from the other candidates
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience in research

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewing with the University of Cincinnati was a complex process that included 3 round of interviewing. 
 This included one on one interviews, student team interviews and an administrative team.    The process was very thorough.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.  
Tell me about why you are a good fit for this position

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: E-mail schedule a time. One on one interview. Questions are all situation related. Give you a situation that you may have during the tutoring session, what will you do? Last about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What if a student answer a question that you do not know the answer?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Students interview with companies at the university career fair. Students can talk with many companies. Then students interview with companies who they are interested in doing COOPs with. All students are required to do COOPs with companies during 5 years.
Interview Questions: What classes have you taken?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates, and making a hire.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose your field of study?

title: Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process involved a call for a salary verification, a phone interview, and then an in-person interview.  The in-person interview was not difficult, but it was a panel interview.  Everyone was warm and pleasant.  It lasted for about an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience with diversity in the workplace.

title: Graduate Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied through employee referral.  I was interviewed by the project manager and was asked some basic questions about SQL. The whole process took 2 weeks. We had normal conversation like what kind of work I am going to do.
Interview Questions: 1. Could you explain in which scenario you use cursors?

title: Title IX Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. I did a Skype interview. Their end didn't work.  I couldn't see them. I was invited for a campus interview. I had to prepare a presentation. I attended a day long interview. While at the interview I received an email informing me that  they would be starting "the referencing process this week."   They didn't. The last interview was with the SVP of Diversity who told me Diversity was her priority. Let's just say I looked a bit.... Irish. During that interview there wasn't a single question I couldn't answer and correctly.  When I mentioned to her that the Committee was to be checking references, she stammered over her words and told me she'd be talking to the chair. 

I checked in several times.  Each time I reminded them of the "referencing process this week."  The first time the response was they would be in touch soon.  I learned the position had been reposted. The second time the response was no final decision was made.  Today I received an email saying the SVP failed the search. 

They still haven't reimbursed my money. 

What a mess of an organization.  They deserve the lawsuits they are getting.
Interview Questions: What is your super power?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a organized process with interviews with two people. They went through all the services offered and gave a brief of their role. They also mentioned the expectations from the student and targets.
Interview Questions: An instance where I had to maintain the privacy of information

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very simple. I applied online and got a call for face to face interview at the campus. I was interviewed by two people, my direct supervisor and Director of the team. It lasted almost 30 mins, very simple questions including my previous work experience and skills. I was also asked about my background with data handling. Interviewers were very friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself and what sort of work experience you have?

title: Senior Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call for a phone interview about two weeks later. A few days after the phone interview, I got a call for an on campus interview, which was scheduled a week later. The in-person interview was with the advising staff, other college staff, and the Dean and lasted about three hours. The questions themselves were pretty basic questions about advising. They also gave you a Microsoft Excel test.  The thing that stuck out to me the most was the corporate feel of office and staff. I didn't feel like I was interviewing at a university. The staff had zero personality and when asked what they liked best about their job, nobody knew how to answer the question. They were all friendly enough, I suppose, but I knew right away that the position was not for me.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult advising experience you have encountered.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Technical Round
- Checked knowledge about R, Tableau
- Checked knowledge about Data Analysis
- Checked knowledge about Client Consultancy
- Work responsibility understanding
- Domain knowledge 
- Tools known
- Certifications done
- Programming languages known
- Kinds of Project Done in past
Interview Questions:
Q: Describe yourself
Q: Talk about your past work experiences

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was grader position for Matlab class. Asked about my experience and asked if I can help students to solve their code problems. I was positive. Explained my profile. Done. Selected.
Interview Questions: Can you write code for sub plot of data in Matlab?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Involved all the typical ingredients ranging from interviews, presentations, meals, faculty meetings, meetings with administration, submission of materials including CV and sample syllabi. Pretty standard operating procedure for a position in academia. Everyone was warm and friendly and not looking to stump me with difficult questions or trip me up in any way.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing UC?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Admission was based on resume. It is also depends on reputation of your master and undergrad school. Reference also helps to get in. My advice to attain graduate recruitment weekend to learn more details of school program.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Support Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly quick and to the point.  They ask about your background knowledge and the jobs and skills listed on your resume.  They were all very nice people to interview for and they make it easy to answer questions.  They will also ask about what you can bring to the table and what skills you have gained since previous employment.
Interview Questions: Basic interview question about prior jobs, experience, what you think the job will be like, why are you a good candidate.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just have a brief interview with PI. Pi asked about my previous experience. sometime asked about the detail how I proceed with the research . explained their research. friendly but serious.
Interview Questions: more professional

title: Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Met with Lab PI brief informal interview. Meet in office talked about the projects that were taking place in this lab and what i would be doing as an intern if i took the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via University employment portal and got an email within three weeks asking to schedule an interview. I had a ~30 minute interview with a panel of employees in the office in a conference room. Everyone was very nice and it was casual. I got an email within a week with the offer.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in three words

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: it was done mainly by submitting necessary documents such as TOEFL, GRE, CV, etc. then I received an offer, this way you get an admission to the school, then you have two chances to take the PhD qualifying exam to become a PhD student.
Interview Questions: there are two part qualifying exams, part one mostly covering undergraduate courses, very broad, part two mainly focused on master courses, four topics of classical mechanics, QM, electrodynamics and statistical mechanics.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: One to one interview. where I had to go through 7 interviews with 7 different professors. They asked me about my research interest and asked me question from Bayesian analysis. they asked me what is trace plot and what is MCMC sampling.
Interview Questions:
1. Question about research 
2. Bayesian  analysis

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via phone and email to come in fof the interview. When I arrived, I met with the manager along with another lady in the department. The interview was pretty straight forward and they were very polite.
Interview Questions: Explain some of the experience you have working with others.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews - The first one was a panel interview with staff and faculty (9 people total). I had to give a presentation during that interview. The second one was with the staff of the office (4 people and 1 person). The process moved quickly due to their timeline, and a few days after the second interview I was given an offer.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses, how I went above and beyond the call of duty, etc. Lots of behavioral questions.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was very good. it was relaxed and made a good imperession. i understood what would be expected of me and i appreciated meeting all the people. i loved working for UC as a student worker. it allowed me to make money and still put school first.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job posting of postdoc fellow. I also emailed the possible PI, I received an email to  schedule a phone interview. Then was the phone interview. Based on the questions, and a good fit, I  visited the lab.  I met with the PI and lab members. I got an offer letter. I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: Q: experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three professor asked me some questions with regard my acdanmia background. And they briefly talked about the basic work for this position. Who should I report to and what kind of questions I might encounter with. I thought the process is fair easy and nothing came to my view that it's a hard interview. They're all pretty stragiht forward and welcome.
Interview Questions: Do you know Bloomberg terminal?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy process and I received support from the office secretary/ Human resources contact. Meeting the school director was casual and friendly. The interview process was about 30-40 minutes, which allowed enough time to discuss previous work experiences.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your teaching history?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Mainly talking and no test process. The professor ask you about your research experience and former jobs. Then Ask how much do you know about the programming environment they are using. At last, he ask what is your expectation of the research job there.
Interview Questions: How long have you been practicing programming?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: We had to fill out an application concerning research which we had been involved in recently, which was relative to what our fellowship research project would be, and depending on if you met the basic qualifications you were awarded the position.
Interview Questions: What is the purpose and significance of your research project of interest ?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews.  The first interview consisted of a panel of five to seven stakeholders.  The second interview was with the department head or chair.  Show enthusiasm for the work and capabilities.
Interview Questions: What is your chief weakness?

title: Student Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: A lot of questions, a lot of situational questions, trick questions and throw off questions are not uncommon. You need to be prepared for a group interview at all times.
Interview Questions: If you could be a fruit what fruit would you be and name three reasons why you'd be that fruit.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Had several interviews, mostly in groups.  Interviewers were very welcoming as was the recruiter.  Make sure you have parking directions down because the campus is sprawling.  Do your homework and know what's going on with the group you hope to join - whats going on in the news, UC website, etc.
Interview Questions: What makes you uniquely qualified to do the job - what do you have that others don't?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: phone interview. asked questions pertaining to laboratory work and my knowledge in the lab. modern pathology knowledge was useful for this position. love my personal investigator but not so much the compensation of the company. very difficult pay for research assistants in the lab.
Interview Questions: explain modern lab techniques

title: Under Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Professor sent out a mass email to the class that there was a position open.  I emailed the contact given in the email.  I was emailed back quickly and an in-person interview was set up.
Interview Questions: What was my past experience?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First I applied online. Then email Communication was established. Then Telephone Interview was set up. later Skype interview. Lot of Technical Questions were asked followed by  general Questions about my interest and why i choose this place etc etc
Then Offer letter was sent . Details for Back ground check was submitted. back ground check took a while.
Then paper work for Visa was sent to apply for the Visa interview..
Interview Questions: First I applied online. Then email Communication was established. Then Telephone Interview was set up. later Skype interview. Lot of Technical Questions were asked followed by  general Questions about my interest and why i choose this place etc etc

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and applied via the jobsatuc.com online portal. After about two to three weeks I was contacted via email to set up a time for a phone interview with the hiring committee. After making it past that phase I was invited to an on-campus interview that lasted about half a day. I had three 1:1 interviews w/ the Director, AVP, and a Director from another unit I would be working with, and a group panel interview. They provided lunch and parking validation as well as detailed directions to/from campus.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to travel? (this was a basic requirement of the position)

title: Student Affairs IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short, simple interview. Was asked about prior IT experience and then given a few hypothetical scenarios. The idea was more to judge my ability to work with an unknown situation and see how I would react than to find an exact answer.
Interview Questions: Someone calls in saying that their printer is no longer working. How do you respond?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very slow... it was around a two month process from when I was told about the job to when I actually ended up at a desk. Only had one interview that was not overly difficult. Very open ended conversation analyzing how my previous skills would or could translate to fulfill the needs of the employer. I was myself and it worked out well.
Interview Questions: Describe how your previous skills relate to doing a, b & c.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Seemed quick compared to other interview processes from the time i applied to my on-campus interview. I believe under 2 weeks. The one frustrating part was as they were waiting for another candidate to interview, it took over 3 weeks to hear anything back as far as an offer. Also, they do not pay for meals at your hotel, only when you're with other staff.
Interview Questions: Describe your background with diversity and inclusion and how you plan to incorporate a diversity and inclusion plan into your program if you were hired.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
My hiring and interview process experience was great for the current position. However, I do feel there is a large gap between the interviews.
I was also one out of two top candidates for another position at UC, in which the interviews were set up with four different people over a course of six months and the fifth interview was still pending when I accepted the Research Coordinator position instead.
However, for both positions, the interviewers were very friendly and I enjoyed interviewing with them. 
For the current position, I had three interviews. The first was a phone screen, second by the Professor hiring me and third by another Professor in the department. The third interview was very detailed and more intense than the three ones, asking a variety of questions about personal and professional life and also, asking what I would do in different case scenarios. Overall it was a good interview to judge how well suited I was for the position. My future goals were also considered.
Interview Questions: I think the most difficult question I was asked was what was the biggest mistake I think I made in my personal life, and I was also asked the same for my professional life.

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews, opportunity to get familiar to other Institutions, potential networking
Interview Questions: Demonstrate your ability to secure federal fund

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. You do not need to prepare anything technical. Just some basic questions about yourself. The resident assistant takes the interview along with the PIA sometimes. Do not forget to take some  printouts of your resumes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: University of Cincinnati/Applied for Various Staff Position Over Past 10 Yrs Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: To be clear, I have never had or been called for an interview with UC. However, I have applied for 20+ various staffing positions throughout the past 10 years AND I am a graduate of a prestigious UC post-graduate program. I am also highly skilled and have higher education experience.
Interview Questions: I share this only to say that despite being both qualified and educated at UC, I have never been contacted for any of the positions for which I applied.  I do not know how anyone manages to get a position at UC but I can only assume that a job seeker MUST know someone to get in the door.

title: PC Support GA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was an on-site interview. The interview lasted for about 45-50 minutes. It was pretty intense though. After the interview was over, they immediately gave me an offer over the phone and an email.
Interview Questions: They basically wanted to know how good I am with computers, printers and software troubleshooting.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Giving a one hour presentation was the first thing to do in the morning. After presentation, I was introduced to the research group. I met with group members for informal conversation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work In this lab?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Getting hired at a University is not an easy process.  I found the people at UC to be very helpful, in spite of all the hoops you have to jump through.  They took me out to a great dinner and showed me around the city.  They even had a realtor show me around, so I could figure out where to buy a house.
Interview Questions: Where do you want to be five years from now?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview process, I simply walked in to ask about my financial aid. The manager just asked if I wanted a job and I said yes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in person interview. Great experience. submitted resume online. received a call. had a phone interview with director. met director in person for interview. very friendly, supportive environment. great place to work!
Interview Questions: What is your teaching style

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: It would be best to talk to a lot of students, professors and administrators to find out new openings. most openings are usually filled before they are officially posted on the student sites so word of moth and internal referrals are king. I got a bit lucky and a random conversation with my future boss on one of the beautiful university greens landed me a position.
Interview Questions: Nothing really, they just want to see if your personality suits the team.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: One of my friends already held a position in the department I interviewed for. She gave me the manager's email, and I set up an interview. I came in wearing a full suit with resumes; however, seeing the process from the other side, it is much more informal. One kid came in looking like he jsut rolled out of bed and still got the job. The marketing and design team work in the same office so it's a mixed culture. Super easy, generic questions. My interview only lasted 15 minutes, and the end, they offered me the position.
Interview Questions: No really surprising/challenging questions.

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: They see the applications and scheduled a Skype interview. There were two interviewers: one is the assistant head of the department and the other is another professor. They tell you what the job assignment is and a little detail of how things work.
Interview Questions:
Q: How did you get into your field of study?
Q: What do you like about it?
Q: What do others say about you?

title: Student Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
You apply online for an opening. If you fit the criteria you can almost guarantee you'll get a call. Then they set up an initial phone interview with HR. If HR likes you then they move you on to the hiring team. Interviews are typically done with a group. Usually, there are at least 3-4 people who will interview you. I was asked to prepare a presentation and could use Powerpoint or handouts. They wanted to see my speaking style and personality since my role deals with the public and I visit a lot of high schools.

The salary negotiation was pretty easy for me. I had been working in higher education for a while and had an idea of what to expect. Plus, as a public university, you can very easily find out what the salary ranges are.
Interview Questions: What does it mean to be student-centered and can you give an example of that?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Interview: Usually varies from Professor to Prof.. Previous experience and good grades do help. You need to follow the research of that prof. and read the recent papers and articles published. Meeting lab mates do help. Go with an open mind set and be well read about the current status of the research going in that lab.
Interview Questions: It will be related to field of research of that Prof.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Applicants for tenure track are reviewed by committee. Top 5-7 applicants are then asked to conduct phone interviews. Phone interview determines an invite for personal interview with faculty, directors, dean, students roughly a week or two later. This visit and presentation is a critical factor. This is a stat run institution. There are many steps and things can move slower than expected.
Interview Questions: How do you describe your teaching philosophy and how do you think it would fit in our program?

title: Architecture Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straight forward with my direct boss, in that I had to tell briefly my previous job experience. Then, I had the chance to talk a little about myself, and after 15 minutes, the interview was over. Later, I was introduced to the employees in the entire floor.
Interview Questions: At the end of the interview I was asked how much I was expected to get paid. Although I was aware that at some point I was going to be asked the question (maybe a second interview of pre-selected candidates, or a phone call), I was surprised by the fact that my boss took his decision of hiring me, after a 10 min interview.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Came through the career development class, which helped prep me advance. It was like speed dating for an internship. This was one of the few paid options. I met with two people on campus, before I met with my later manager.
Interview Questions: What websites do you check most often?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Cincinnati
Interview Descriptions: Very long and drawn out.  Due to all the red tape interviewing and hiring is an extremely lengthy process.  Your interview experience will depend on the university department you are interviewing with.
Interview Questions: Could be subjected inappropriate questions.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone and through emails with the professor. i was asked to talk about my previous research experience and publications and want i want to do in my next step
Interview Questions: what are your research goals

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Found job through major.   Required night shifts.  One interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: A classic behavioral type interview including academic achievements. It was conducted by phone and in a friendly tone. The head of the department along with a full time professor were the ones to interview me. I was expecting to go very deep into my previous academic life but I guess my cover letter and my resume covered most of the parts.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest achievement during your undergraduate degree?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: very easy no complaints at all I enjoyed the interview did not take long at all got the job right away would gladly tell my friend to work here. one of the best places I have work at great benefoits not too hard to get a interview here
Interview Questions: past jobs

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Brief talked with principal investigator of the project and meet with project manager to understand the goal of the project and the tasks to submit for each month and what their expectation for the end result.
Interview Questions: What is your plan in the future

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a very quick phone interview. A faculty member called me and asked me to introduce myself based on my resume. Asked my teaching experience and some research questions, although they did not require it at all. Also asked me some behavior questions, and there was no surprise. The job offer was made the next week.
Interview Questions: No surprise

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: She talked about the position, and she had me take a test in regards to accounting and Excel. She toured the office as well.
Interview Questions: How is this job help your goal?

title: Innovations Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and cover letter.  Then, 3-4 days later recieved a call from the hiring manager asking me to come in for an interview.  I was then interviewed for about 45 minutes by two higher ups.  They were extremely nice, and asked me a few questions about why I applied for the position and other basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest weaknesses

title: Adjunct Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview.  I was contacted to teach and I accepted.  I had met the decision maker previously and this person approached me to see if I would be interested in teaching 3 classes per semester. .  I had to fill out an online application, but no interview.  They did a background check and emailed the paperwork. .
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Follow the guidelines on UC's website. In general a personnel statement, transcript, and 3 letters of references were submitted.  A phone or one-on-one interview usually follows. On occasion you are sometime invited to the lab's weekly meeting to meet the group.
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult questions.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was approached by one of my previous Professors to be a Teaching Assistant for the upcoming quarter. My professor told me what to expect, the required office hours, off campus work and communication. The interview itself was rather short. It focused on my curriculum knowledge and academic career. My professor was satisfied with my academic career and extended me the offer.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions. Very straight forward questions about basic economics knowledge.

title: Assistant Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: First did a telephone screening interview. Then was asked to do a second interview. Was interviewed by 8 different people in one day. Group fit was important to them. They made the process really long. First applied for the job in April, did last interview in July and they're still going to be doing other rounds of interviews.
Interview Questions: Questions about development experience.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was relaxed and professional. I answered questions regarding my design work and work history. It was a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Go through the website. Application process took 3 months. Attend the lab group meeting and then meet the professor in person.
Interview Questions: There weren't many difficult questions. Just background check and job description.

title: Mechanical Development Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I have been interviewed 4 times but still no result.I get almost every week one email stating my application is still in process.
Interview Questions: Tell something about your last experience

title: Computer Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: You are given a interview mainly by an employee recommending you.
Interview Questions: What is you weakness?

title: Associate Professor Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process is as follows: The college posts a call for applicants. From that pool a committee chooses 5 top candidates to conduct a phone interview. During the phone interview the committee reviews your portfolio and vitae while they talk to you. If you do well they will invite you to present your work in front of the faculty and the students. So prepare 2 presentations. After all of the top candidates present, the faculty compare notes and recommendations from other faculty and students and decide who gets the job. The entire process can take weeks to months before you hear if you are accepted or not.
Interview Questions: What is your research focus and how do you expect it to contribute to the research of this department.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Two separate step, phone interview and onsite interview. Very quickly and effectively.  Different position will have different interview process. This is depend on what kind of position you applied. Typically, the research position is only determined by research principal investigator, the boss of the lab.
Interview Questions: future plan

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: The process was confusing and time consuming. There were a number of people involved who seemed to have no idea what they were doing. The primary interviewer did not know as much about the position as she should have.
Interview Questions: Would you like to reconsider your application?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview in my field. Presented a lecture of original research with Q&A. Meeting with faculty search committee: asked about reasons for wanting to teach at UC, potential courses I could offer, interests in classroom teaching vs. research. Meeting with graduate students in the department: very varied areas of interest, some clearly liked my specialty, some were openly hostile to it. Interviewed by: dean, one-on-one time with chair of the search committee, lunch with other members of the committee (being asked detailed questions about publication experiences working with specific presses, editing experience, etc.), and meeting with HR to review benefits package. Taught one class meeting of a required course for majors. Very friendly and helpful atmosphere in general.
Interview Questions: Should all majors in the field be required to take a course in [a particularly detailed subject related directly to my speciality]?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Being a University, interviews for positions are done by individual departments.
For a position like a graduate research assistant in the engineering department, the interview is typically a 1:1 by the hiring faculty. Depending on the faculty, the interview is usually pretty informal where there is a discussion about the on-going research projects and your career interests. 
The campus exemplifies diversity and provides many opportunities to develop you professional and interpersonal skills. Although guidance is provided, making use of such opportunities are entirely dependent on the individual.
Interview Questions: Nothing hard, after all it was an interview for graduate student research position.

title: Graduate Assistant] Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Simple and easy general research related questions
Interview Questions: What ar your strenth?
